newsitem.title: USA: Vermont November unemployment rate at 4.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: Vermont November unemployment rate at 4.5 pct.

text.p: Vermont posted a seasonally adjusted unemployment rate of 4.5 percent for November, unchanged from the October estimate, a state Department of Employment and Training release said.
The comparable rate for the U.S. in November was 5.4 percent, a 2/10s of a point increase from the previous rate, the release said.

Unemployment rates for Vermont's 13 labor market areas ranged from 1.8 percent in Hartford-Lebanon to 8.9 in Newport. Labor market area rates are not seasonally adjusted; for comparison, the unadjusted rate for Vermont was 4.4 percent.

"Unemployment stabilized after six consecutive monthly increases," Susan Auld, commissioner of the Employment and Training Department, said. "Annual job growth, however, remained modest as it has throughout 1996."
